DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to investigate whether methylphenidate (Ritalin) can actively induce emergence from general anesthesia in patients having a pancreaticoduodenectomy (Whipple procedure), a pancreatectomy, or a prostatectomy.
DOC.brief_title: Reversal of General Anesthesia With Methylphenidate
DOC.criteria: Age 1875 years American Society of Anesthesiologists classification 1 or 2 Scheduled to undergo a pancreaticoduodenectomy or distal pancreatectomy at Massachusetts General Hospital American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status classification of 3 or beyond.
